utterance.content: I am not going to accuse a woman of trying to murder her own husband simply based on some paranoid theory.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s the only explanation. We’ve eliminated every other possibility.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We have not eliminated every other possibility!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Has he responded to the latest lupus treatment?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He’s only been on it for a few hours.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He hasn’t responded because it’s not lupus! It’s not allergies, ALS, arthritis or sarcoidosis. She’s all that’s left. Do it!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hi, I’m Dr. House. Mind if I take a look in your purse?

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because I’m going to need to search it and you for whatever you’re using to poison your husband.

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: Why would I want to hurt my husband?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then you won’t mind if I search your things.

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: Go ahead. You satisfied?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Absolutely not.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She agreed to let me search everywhere else, but this she says no to. Doesn’t that tell you something?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Yes, that she doesn’t want some lunatic doctor searching her vagina with a flashlight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cameron can do that.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I am not going to –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The woman hasn’t left the hospital since they arrived. Whatever she’s using she’s obviously hiding somewhere.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She’s not poisoning him!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s the only explanation!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No, it’s the only explanation your twisted mind can come up with because you’re angry that you can’t find the answer and you’re taking it out on her!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And you are protecting a complete stranger based on some childishly romantic notion that people are all so happily married they don’t want to kill each other!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Are you calling me childish?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Grow up.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Shut up. Both of you. And stay away from his wife. Sorry, I’m not giving you permission to assault someone.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Let’s see… I’m thinking Colonel Mustard, in the music room, with the candlestick.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There’s no music room, it’s the conservatory.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Same thing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, it isn’t. If we don’t find out what she’s using, start treatment immediately, he’ll be dead in a week.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If you’re right. If Foreman’s right, you’d have basically raped an innocent woman. My wife fired the maid. Apparently she’s getting rid of anything that reminds her of me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You did your maid?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I was nice to our maid, which annoyed her, God knows why.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Maybe she was doing her.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No one was doing her, all right?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But you still feel responsible. Even though nothing or no one was done, it’s still your fault.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I offered to keep paying her salary until she found another job, but she refused to take any money without doing any work, so…. If you want someone to clean your apartment, it’s on me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re supposed to be moving out, not moving more people in.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She’s not moving in, she’s gonna clean!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Maybe I should just move out, and the two of you could –

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: Oh, God! Oh, God, no!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Call a code! Charging 360, give him epi! Clear!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Still no pulse.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Charging! Clear!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I got a pulse. Pupils are reactive. You still with us?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He was without oxygen for less than a minute, can’t be hypoxia. Could be a stroke.

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: Can you hear me?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Back up.

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: Bob, talk to me! Bob! Honey, please!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Bob, can you hear me?

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: He’s awake!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Can you hear me?

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: Honey? Hi.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes, she is quite the little actress.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So, let’s say she’s not poisoning him.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There’s nothing more to discuss. We’ve got lung and kidney failure, neurological symptoms, and now cardiac arrest. A systemic disease with multi-organ involvement is the definition of lupus.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Auto-immunosuppressant aren’t helping.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We should start him on cyclophosphamide, see if it makes a difference.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, and interferon.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Interferon isn’t an approved treatment for lupus.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You’re not still thinking –

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Interferon isn’t an approved treatment for heavy metal toxicity, either.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: True. But it’s pretty much the only thing we can do for a viral infection. We didn’t consider it because it doesn’t –

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Because it doesn’t make sense! There’s no fever!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because he’s got no immune system, thanks to the immunosuppressant you prescribed him for lupus treatment.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He didn’t present with a fever, either.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because at that point he was a post-viral autoimmune reaction, which again, thanks to the immunosuppressants you prescribed for lupus treatment, his immune system basically rolled out the red carpet for the dormant virus, waking it up, turning it into a present viral infection. Give him interferon.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: But if it is lupus, interferon could make it worse. Suppress his bone marrow even further.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which is more likely, a rapidly progressing, acute onset lupus in a patient who’s already on steroids or a team of doctors missing a post-viral reaction?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We didn’t miss anything.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, then, I’m wrong, and you shouldn’t. Give him interferon!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Intravenous interferon has been shown to be effective against some viral infections.

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: But I thought you said it wasn’t an infection. You said it was lupus!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The increasingly rapid progression of the symptoms has caused us to reconsider.

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: And what if you’re wrong here, too? What if it’s not a virus?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There are risks with interferon, especially in a patient who’s already immunosuppressed. Look, at this point your lungs, kidneys and heart are all failing. We really don’t have any choice.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: I cheated.

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: 9th grade. Earth science. Mr. Foley. I sat behind you so I could cheat off of you.

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: And I let you cheat so you’d sit behind me.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: I thought we were gonna grow old together.

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: In 9th grade?

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: No, 10th.

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: What, you had to make sure I put out first?

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: No, I knew you put out in the 7th grade. I love you.

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: Yeah, I know.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: Say you love me.

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: Because you’re not dying.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: Say it anyway. You gonna make me hurt you?

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: I love you.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It’s not working. Both his lungs and his kidneys are continuing to deteroriate.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Up the dose.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We already have.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Apparently not enough.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I don’t think it’s a virus. We’ve been running titers for everything we could think of, they’re all negative.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Increase the interferon.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You got a better idea, other than lupus?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then up the dose.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Mr. and Mrs. Lambert’s appointment was over an hour ago.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry, I was sick. And my team needed an emergency consult. Your wife has herpes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You haven’t had an outbreak. Yet. Don’t worry, you will.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Doesn’t mean he got it first. You don’t need to have an outbreak to spread the virus.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, you two obviously have a lot to talk about.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Don’t even think about dumping this on my lap.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I’m sorry, there is no test –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Either of you two ever sit on a public toilet? Well?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Herpes can live for short periods of time outside the body.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Dr. House, you know you can’t get herpes from –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Some politically correct doctors will tell you that it’s impossible to get infected by a toilet seat, but they’ll also tell you not to use the same bath towel to dry your crotch and your face during an outbreak. See the contradiction?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Always?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What about you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Damn, I was sure it was Miyagi.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He could believe that you could get herpes from a toilet seat, or he could be cheating on you and be happy to have an out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sure, but she’d only refuse to believe such a well presented lie if she were innocent. And since you both can’t be innocent, you ruddy jackass.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My pleasure.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Wow. Not bad.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She has a family history of arthritis, doesn’t she?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Yeah, she does. What does –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Stop the interferon. Do another heavy metal screen, only this time test for gold.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You don’t still think that she –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And don’t let her go to the bathroom!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Why would you care if she – hello?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Lady
utterance.content: Hi, I’m Lady.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What did you do to my closet?

utterance.speaker: Lady
utterance.content: Uh, I cleaned it. Dr. Wilson said that I could go ahead and –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s not Dr. Wilson’s closet! Where’s the wood box?

utterance.speaker: Lady
utterance.content: Wood box?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, the wood box. It’s made of wood, and it’s box-shaped. It’s been in the back of this closet since the day I moved in.

utterance.speaker: Lady
utterance.content: I didn’t see any kind of –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, you may not have seen it, but you’ve obviously moved it. The question is, where?

utterance.speaker: Lady
utterance.content: Well, I did not move anything, I just left the –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Look, it was in this closet, then you came, now it’s not in this closet!

utterance.speaker: Lady
utterance.content: What type of box is it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wood! Wood! It’s a brown, wood box, it’s got a metal handle, it looks like a tackle or a toolbox –

utterance.speaker: Lady
utterance.content: Ah, you mean the chest! The one that’s under the bed?

utterance.speaker: Lady
utterance.content: Do you need to fix something?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Um, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: Fine, then I’ll go to one on another floor.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Actually, they’re not working there, either.

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: Every bathroom in the whole hospital is out of order?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Well, there, um, the water –

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: I’m going to the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Where is she?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She had to go to the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I told you not to let her.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What was I supposed to do? Tie her up?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why not, she likes that.

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: What are you doing? Uh, your hand is wet.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry, must be nervous. I got some bad news.

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The damage to your husband’s lungs is permanent. Kidney damage is reversible and with the right therapy he should regain full neurological function. Other than the fact that he’s not going to be running any marathons, he’s going to be fine.

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: But that’s good news, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m not finished. When I was a kid, my dad was stationed at a marine base in Egypt. We were in the middle of nowhere and there was absolutely nothing for a kid to do except look for a mummy’s tomb.

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: You didn’t want me to go to the bathroom because you wanted to tell me my husband is going to be fine and that you used to live in Egypt?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn’t have a problem with you going to the bathroom. I just didn’t want you to wash your hands. I never actually did find a mummy, but I did learn a fair amount about the ancient Egyptians. For example, they discovered that stannous chloride is not only great for toughening ruby glass, but if it’s mixed with gold, it turns bright purple. Now, either your fingers are actually worth their weight in gold, or you’ve been sprinkling your husband’s cereal with gold sodium thiomalate. It’s an arthritis remedy it’s rarely used here in the US, but it’s still popular in Mexico. I’ve gotta give you props. I’ve never heard of anyone using gold before. It’s almost… poetic.

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: That’s ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Heavy metal tox screen for gold was off the chart.

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: Why would I –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because you were trying to kill him, I’d love to know the why behind that why. But you’re not going to tell me, are you?

utterance.speaker: Maria
utterance.content: You’re wrong. I love Bob.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I never said you didn’t love him.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Why would somebody do that? Sit by somebody’s beside day and night, helping them, comforting them, and at the same time killing them?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Maybe he was having an affair?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Maybe she was having an affair.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or maybe she just gets her kicks slowly sucking the life out of a guy and watching him suffer.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He must have done something to her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, he had it coming.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I didn’t say he deserved it.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The only thing he did wrong was marry a sociopath.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or maybe she just got tired of being married. Didn’t want to admit to family and friends that the marriage that everyone thought was perfect wasn’t.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Shouldn’t one of us stay with her? If she tries to run –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, Cameron, go back there. Well, it would be weird if we were all in the ladies’ room.

utterance.content: We started chelation therapy with dimercaprol.

utterance.content: Thrilled to hear it.

utterance.content: It will.

utterance.content: He’s becoming more attractive by the minute, isn’t he?

utterance.content: You’re pleased. You think you’ve proved every marriage is a mistake.
